title: Definition of Probability
text: The probability of any outcome in the sample space occuring is the long-term relative frequency of that oucome. Effectively, to find the probability of an event, P(event), we need to find the size of that event (how many outcomes are in it) and divide that by the size of the sample space (how many outcomes are in it).
speech: The probability of any outcome in the sample space occuring is the long-term relative frequency of that oucome. Effectively, to find the probability of an event, P(event), we need to find the size of that event (how many outcomes are in it) and divide that by the size of the sample space (how many outcomes are in it).

title: Number of Clubs

title: Determining Probability of Club
text: What is the probability of drawing a red card in a standard deck of $$52$$ cards, or what is the number of red cards divided by the total number of cards?
speech: What is the probability of drawing a red card in a standard deck of  52  cards, or what is the number of red cards divided by the total number of cards?
